website_summaries.verdict: Finger-sized keys and tons of instrument voices make this miniature keyboard a winner for young kids.
pros: Outfitted with 32 mini keys, 100 instrument voices, and 50 pre-programmed tracks
Can play up to eight notes at once for chords
Keys are a good size for small children
cons: Does not come with power cord
Keys may stop working over time

customer_reviews.title: No power supply included.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard costs $39, and it can't be used right out of the box. The box doesn't say that neither batteries or power plug is not included. False advertising. I purchased this for a gift for our grandson. Now will have to order a power supply.
customer_reviews.author: ProOrganizerFL

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I call it my Baby Grand. Sometimes one of my groups does not have an accompanist and we have to sing acapella. That's fine, but we need our starting pitches, so I take this along. Not every rehearsal venue has a piano or keyboard, so I can plunk out parts for those who need it. I keep it in my living room so if a tune is swirling around my head, I can pick it out. I can tuck it under my arm and take it anywhere. This is not a toy. It sounds like a good quality piano and the intonation is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Bionaz

customer_reviews.title: A little irritated..
customer_reviews.text: Good product but you will go through a lot of batteries because it doesn't come with a power cord. That probably should've been mentioned in the description. My daughter got it for her birthday and couldn't even use it bc we didnt have 6 batteries to drop down in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great but it arrived with the display all busted. Kids lost some faith in Santa with this one. To bad, it seems like a nice beginner keyboard. If you get a good one, it'll probably be fun to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: DANA MERIZZI

customer_reviews.title: Harmonium Lovers will love this little giant. TONE 16
customer_reviews.text: this was a replacement of HARMONIUM, it sounds exactly the same! I cant stay without it now. My wife gets annoyed cause I even play when I am watching a movie. You don't need an power adapter cause batteries last really long. very handy. I thought the battery compartment should have been screwed in, cause sometimes it just opens when you carry it around. But still 10 freakin stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Farooq Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: good as a toy.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to learn on this, but the "toy-ness" of it makes it hard for me to stand hearing for too long. It fits in a backpack though, and my friend who is already very good at piano can make it sound great when he plays it. for practicing your chords for the first time though, I'd recommend something with clearer sound. it has a headphone jack, but its pretty rough to listen to through headphones because again, it sounds like a toy. if its for a kid, or you dig the toy sound though- go for it! I'm going for the Roland go- keys instead. portable, but high quolity.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great little piano for travel
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves playing the piano keyboard, but all I had was a full size model at home. It is bulky and needs to be dragged from the closet and set up when she wants to play. This had been a perfect solution. We can take this to the park, on car rides, pretty much anywhere. Because it's so small it is always ready for my daughter when inspiration hits. Of course, a full size keyboard is also important for learning to play piano properly, but this is a good addition.
customer_reviews.author: FinalBoss808

customer_reviews.title: Cool little keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, accept it for what it is. It is not a full-sized digital piano with full-sized weighted touch sensitive keys. Wouldn’t expect that for the price. It has some great sounds, rhythms, and drum keys. Speakers are okay, headphone out into other speakers if desired. Great for sitting in the easy chair noodling or to figure out chords for creating backing tracks. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: defective battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: This came defective - battery compartment was not wired properly. Bought this specifically for portability but it's useless. Have to use DC instead. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: unlicatty

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Fat adult fingers ok. Great material.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy. I'm a piano teacher. And this thing works for me to Bring on my travels. Great sound. Big and fat fingers still fit too. Kids love it. Good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Piano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Singers
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female singer and I use this to practice my notes . The range on the keyboard covers all of the notes I would ever use for singing. The variety of sounds that this keyboard can make also helps me pair my voice to a tone that closer matches my voice. For the price, this things is great. It's portable and easily stored.
customer_reviews.author: Brainy Gal

customer_reviews.title: Was a birthday present for my 3 year old granddaughter ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a birthday present for my 3 year old granddaughter, she bangs away on it and really enjoys the built in tunes, especially "ode to joy". She really loves it.
customer_reviews.author: William Glennon

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! But really no cord to plug into ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it! But really no cord to plug into wall? Must purchase separately $15. Didn’t realize this till my son opened it on Christmas Day. Typically this comes with something when you buy it. Had I know this I wouldn’t of ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Reids

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the toddler piano that my daughter has
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the toddler piano that my daughter has. Bought this second one so that both my kids would have something to play with at the same time. This is an actual instrument that will allow multiple keys to be pressed at the same time, with a wide variety of sound options. Very pleased with the features. It's also plenty durable to take the abuse of my kids playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: RandR10

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I almost kept it cause it worked but the lcd screen looked weird. Just worried something else is wrong supposed to be a Christmas present and really don’t want it to stop working so I’m going to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: great value for money
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for a seven year old. She loved the keyboard right away. The sound is what you would expect for the price. Enough effects to make it interesting. I would probably buy the next size up for any child who might want to study keyboard further. It is a little limiting for the beginner piano courses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough keys
customer_reviews.text: The sounds were great on this device, but the name led me to believe that there were 46 keys, rather than what's there. There were not enough keys to allow me to use this for the reasons it was purchased, but there are other things I will be able to use it for, and its size makes it very easy to transport and use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kick Back, Put it on your Lap and Twiddle Away
customer_reviews.text: Has small keys, making you pay attention to hand position. Has hair trigger action, making you improve your precision. Very light weight. Has cool built-ins if you want to goof around, or get your kids interested. Kick back, put it on your lap or lap desk, play along, or find online sheet music. Find a piece of stiff cardboard to lay on your laptop keyboard, put the Casio on it, and you have an inter-active lyre!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little keyboard. I bought this for my daughter who was interested in learning. It portable and easy to use. I would recommend this for anyone that wants a small quality keyboard for a child, teen, or adult. We have had ours for almost a year now and it is still doing well even after some rough abuse from the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Dillon

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT COME WITH DC CONVERTER!!!
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT COME WITH DC CONVERTER!!! You need this to operate the keyboard without batteries. Kinda lame that it’s not included. Otherwise 5 stars for my 7 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: DTT

customer_reviews.title: Surprising sound
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great deal. Bought it for our 6 year old for Christmas and she loves it. It’s got a lot of settings and the size is wonderfully compact without inhibiting it’s use. It sounds like so many of the instruments it has as options, which gives it more value. I didn’t expect it to be so nice given the price, but very impressed. I’d say even for an adult novice this is perfect and sounds impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: It's fine.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a keyboard for derping around...this is fine. Introduce your kids to piano playing? Yeah, sure. Play around with friends or by yourself? Why not? Useful for teaching yourself piano...I mean sure, if you're really motivated and kinda broke. Like, it's fine. It's kind of a fun little toy, but it didn't suit my needs. It's more of a plaything than an instrument. I found the sound to be very tinny, and the fact that it takes 6 AA batteries very inconvenient since it doesn't come with an AC adapter. What can I say? It's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Eldie

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable bad product experience, this does not come with a (1) microphone (2) no charger and (3) no batteries. The product description is totally wrong and sometimes even the pictures you see will not match the product you receive in the mail. We orderer w silver casio and received a green one. Pathetic
customer_reviews.author: Jeev  Cal

customer_reviews.title: Great value with quite a bit of versatility
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my special needs child who is a self-taught keyboardist. She loves it It is the perfect size for her ( she is 4’10”) and has enough keys to play a full range of songs that she has taught herself. Uses AA batteries. Seems well made for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Sounds and plays great, keys fall off
customer_reviews.text: First off it's the best keyboard in this price range, playable, good sounds, it's a real instrument for sure. I had to knock off two stars for how easy the black keys come off. Granted you should expect to beat this thing up but with just a little playing time they were falling off with a slight nudge. Fix this issue and its five star.
customer_reviews.author: Jay SD

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable volume is great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my toddler just for fun and he absolutely loves it. Adjustable volume so that’s great.
customer_reviews.author: C A R A

customer_reviews.title: Works as a tool or toy
customer_reviews.text: A nice, simple toy keyboard, but not for someone looking for a real instrument. The keys are mini, so that might irritate some. It works well, though, and serves my purpose. If you are just looking for a way to plunk out notes for at home vocal practice and/or a GOOD toy keyboard for a younger person, then this is a good, inexpensive option.
customer_reviews.author: Theater Geek

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I started out giving this product a 5 star rating, however I had to change that review because this item has completely stopped working. I’ve changed out the batteries, I’ve tried an adapter... it just doesn’t work after less than two months.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymity

customer_reviews.title: Missing the power cord
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just opened this for Christmas and it’s missing the power cord...
customer_reviews.author: Candice0521

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $44, maybe $29
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money, would say this is a toy for infant not for toddler but the buttons are very non intuitive. It’s 1980s tech and pricing, way overpriced compared to its quality and other keyboards on the market.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard - but must use batteries, no power cord.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. Looks & sounds great for what it is. I would give 5 stars except for the fact that this keyboard is designed to be used with a bunch of AA batteries. There is no power cord for plugging into an outlet. Looking closely, it appears that there is a slot where one could plug in a power cord, but to do so would require sourcing and acquiring one that fits.
customer_reviews.author: Buttersnotch

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves it! Nice sound and has a nice headphone jack so the practicing in the car is a little more tolerable for others. This is definitely not a substitute for something more professional if you are trying to become a pianist but works fine for someone trying to learn the basics or play by ear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: appropriate for moving a child from a toy to real keyboard
customer_reviews.text: For what we wanted this seems to be a perfect fit. Our great grandson got this for his sixth birthday took to it immediately. It his small enough for him to work with, he is not a prodigy, and by the time we move him up to a full size keyboard next year, with lessons he should be ready. Most important, he likes and is motivated to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G Maher

customer_reviews.title: We like that it takes batteries too because sometimes we school ...
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about music. Purchased this for my son who I am homeschooling. He's only 3. Wanted to expose him to the piano. He loves this thing. My husband who was once a professional musician picked it out for us. For our purpose, this was the right size, right price point. We like that it takes batteries too because sometimes we school outside.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Kids and Dad love it
customer_reviews.text: Even if its too early to learn playing, my kids love the built in effects and tunes. Combined with the keyboard stickers and John Jester’s Easy Keyboard book, it’s a great beginners tool. And nice for small hands. Battery consumptions seems reasonable with normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: BusyParent

customer_reviews.title: Not only a great toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t imagine how great this small keyboard works! My 5 month old baby loves it and the keys are easy for him to press! I also love it as an entertaining tool for these days! Fun for quarantine time! The only cons for this keyboard is you need 6 pieces of AA batteries to make it works which is not eco-friendly for our planet.so I use rechargeable batteries for this one.
customer_reviews.author: justamom

customer_reviews.title: 2 pianos in a row bite the dust
customer_reviews.text: We exchanged it once within a month of my son's birthday bc the digital screen was going in and out. We got the replacement. Now within a month's time, the piano is completely mute all the time. So, I attempt to return it again, and my refund is $8 less than what I originally paid, and ordering a 3rd replacement was not an option. I would like my FULL refund, especially after the hassle of sending it back, not to mention my 6 year old son is pretty disappointed his new keyboard does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lindseykonfara

customer_reviews.title: Cute little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my toddler cousin as a birthday gift to encourage some early creativity. He seems to love it. Good selection of well-known tubes to dance, sing and eventually play along with! Volume get ample loud. My only complaint is that the battery door is a bit on the loose side and we had to tape it down to prevent it from falling off when jolted.
customer_reviews.author: Sam T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  gift for Mom!
customer_reviews.text: Bought if fo my 92 yr old Mother and it fits perfectly on her lap ! Not to many things make her happy these days but I put in the batteries set it on her lap and it’s been 20 minutes now and she hasn’t stopped playing
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Jean Yokoyama

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound
customer_reviews.text: It's not rocket science nowadays to make good synthetic tones. Casio makes a great watch for $25 but cant make a good keyboard unfortunately., I gave it away, was not fun to play with a toy-sounding piano.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Meece

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun! Quite durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our toddler who can be rough on toys. He and I both have fun playing with it and it has no real signs of damage or malfunction after 5 months of use. Also, it takes a million batteries and didn't come with an adapter but it does shut itself off after not using for a bit which has saved a lot of money if batteries. Next step to buy the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: A great little portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great small keyboard. Lots of instrument sounds including keyboards, brass, flutes, strings, and drums. Some built-in songs. The sounds themselves aren't studio quality, but they're pretty good for a small, portable keyboard...typical of Casio for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ourc4 year old wanted a keyboard from target with a cat on it. I wanted one that could grow up with her. This fit the bill. She only played with it 15 minutes at a time twice a week over the past month. So far the battery life is doing ok.
customer_reviews.author: Lm Pink

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not only was this box NOT handed to a resident, there is a key on the board that is sticking up. I am not a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: LORI D.

customer_reviews.title: great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive keyboard has excellent sound quality, and can make quite a few different sounds (i.e. piano, organ, etc). I bought this for my 4 year old nephew who won't be parted with it now! He was able to use it immediately, intuitively setting the sounds and other things. I am not techno-savvy and was impressed at how easily he took to this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: pamela j

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a grandchild that I hadn’t seen in a while. I bought his younger brother another gift and wound up having to get another one of these as well since they both enjoyed it so much! They are seven and five-year-olds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5yo son so he could be introduced to a musical instrument and learn how to read music. This keyboard is a perfect size for him, and he loves all the features (like the different tones and songs it can play).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany B

customer_reviews.title: Fun Keyboard for Children of All Ages
customer_reviews.text: Sold as a toy but it works fine for me, a grown man. Handy to carry around and tinker with. Has nice sounds. I'm not a great musician but tinkering on the keyboard is a great way to relax.
customer_reviews.author: frank124c

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing as a toy for my daughter. The songs on here are great and she can use her headphones to really play for her own enjoyment as opposed to just making noise.
customer_reviews.author: Julio briceno

customer_reviews.title: No cord to plug it in?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old granddaughter as a starter keyboard due to her interest in playing an instrument. The keyboard will suffice, however I was disapponted and surprised it does not come with an ac cord to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Romans828

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: It has a lot of presets, #77 of which I like best when run through a guitar delay pedal. Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Shumate

customer_reviews.title: A poor man's dream trap...
customer_reviews.text: The keys kept sticking right out of the box. Yeah, you get what you pay for, nonetheless, it needs to at least perform in a functional manner. Could have been fun if the keys weren't so finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Salieb

customer_reviews.title: I love this Casio keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: Takes batteries, but going to get a wall plug in. My 4yr old likes it, there are different auto tunes and she loves them. She will turn on a song & pretend she playing it or just use it as her "radio". Anyway great for the price :)
customer_reviews.author: ginamarine

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome beginner keyboard for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome beginner keyboard for kids. My 6 year old has basic keyboard knowledge, and figured out the beats very quickly. She uses this to write her own beats. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard. My 4 year old has been taking piano lessons for 6 months and we needed something at home for him to practice on. This has been a great tool. Sounds great, lightweight, portable.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Everything proved to be just fine and it has provide a comfortable practice tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to practice cords. I was concerned the keys would be too small and the spacing close to be of value to her. Everything proved to be just fine and it has provide a comfortable practice tool.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: FUN LITTLE KEYBOARD FOR ALL AGES!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun little tiny keyboard. My daughter ( 2yo) loves banging on it and listening to the prerecorded songs and beats. Sometimes I think I have more fun with this thing than her though. It takes a lot of batteries so I'll probably buy a power cord to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: It was broken...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as open box. Keys were broken off. Not useable. Should have been trashed and not resold. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Clark

customer_reviews.title: Due to reading reviews I chose this keyboard for my 8yr old great granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: She was thrilled to get this. Can't write a lot about it, because she is still learning to use. Because of the review, I bought the plug-in adapter. Saves buying batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: This Thing's a Gem
customer_reviews.text: Well it's a thrill to use and you wouldn't believe some of the sounds that come out of there. Especially if you coupled it with a computer through the sound port. : )
customer_reviews.author: Electric Apes a Me

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter likes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a six year old granddaughter for Christmas. I also bought the adapter as it did not come w one. She likes so that is all that counts. I especially like the headphone jack!
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: This little keyboard is perfect for me since I travel a lot
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is perfect for me since I travel a lot. The keys might be a little smaller, but they're still perfectly playable.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen J. Glick

customer_reviews.title: Write music on the fly... DONE!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to practice little jingles and songs. Works perfectly anywhere and easy to use and carry around. Batteries last long too. Perfect little instrument.
customer_reviews.author: NikNak

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for... Works perfectly. Has tons of sound/rhythm options & plays songs. Hours of entertainment so far! Has traveled on several road trips- SO THANKFUL for the headphone jack!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful mini keyboard, great sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Casio mini keyboard, great sound and many features. 48 keys. Has less octaves though but otherwise a fine mini keyboard. 5/5 stars. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kiehn

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very please with this keyboard. I was hapoy that the battery compartment closure was intact and not defective as I had this issue with a different one. Sound quality is good. Durable item.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Wasilewski

customer_reviews.title: Good quality piano!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it and I am glad i purchased this because there are so many different sounds that you can use. I also wanted to get a good quality piano and this is it! It is battery operated but you should invest in rechargeable batteries and a charger and you wont have to buy batteries over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great for Any Age
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old granddaughter for Christmas and it is a great quality. Has a lot of features and she loves playing with it. I feel this is good for any age because of all the great features.
customer_reviews.author: SavannahsNana

customer_reviews.title: My 19 month Grandson loved it. Perfect for small fingers and he kept ...
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month Grandson loved it. Perfect for small fingers and he kept wanting me to play another song! Well made product and think the whole family will enjoy for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Tara N

customer_reviews.title: SO fun
customer_reviews.text: I LOOOVVE this especially because it's portable. Can play on the go. It can be annoying for those around you, but it's too addicting.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Frick

customer_reviews.title: the size is just right
customer_reviews.text: nothing to say, kids like it and it's small enough to travel and not be cumbersome. my 6 and 8 year olds are still playing with it
customer_reviews.author: Charlieswolf

customer_reviews.title: Looooooove it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!!!! One of our best purchases for our 6 month old! We use the Joovy walker with it and it fits perfectly! Our baby just walks along and plays her piano! We can’t recommend this enough!!!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lau

customer_reviews.title: This is not 46 keys!
customer_reviews.text: This has 32 keys, not 46! I think the title (SA-46 -key) is very misleading, even if they say the amount of keys in the description. The sound is good but I feel duped and will probably return this as I wanted something with more keys. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is such an awesome keyboard. We let our kids use it and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome keyboard. We let our kids use it and they love banging on the keys or using a pre-set song to dance to music. It's definitely a great buy for our tots.
customer_reviews.author: AC_12

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Durable and versatile. Fantastic value! Bought Dec 2018 for my 1 year old to explore music with her dad and in Feb 2020 it is STILL going strong on the original set of batteries with regular play from a toddler. I realize that’s not what most people would probably buy this for, but I feel it’s a testament to the quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: For small children
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a toy. Tiny keys, low quality sound. You get what you pay for here. Ok for little children though.
customer_reviews.author: JF2013

customer_reviews.title: Grammy’s purchase
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard sounds great. My granddaughter loves it. My only complaint is that there is no AC/Dc plug for alternate Current. Years ago, I had purchased a lesser quality Casio that used either battles or direct current via a plug in wire. Otherwise, I would have given it 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my daughter. Sounded great and could turn it down to where I didn't hear it in the next room.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi R.

customer_reviews.title: great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to study scales and keys and such with it in my lap. It's obviously not a high fidelity instrument, but it is perfectly acceptable for my studies.
customer_reviews.author: lisa c.

customer_reviews.title: ok toy keyboard
customer_reviews.text: my daughter wanted a practice keyboard before we splurged and got her a nice one . Good for young children but def not the beat quality . Decent toy keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Blanca lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my one year old. She loves the buttons and all the sounds. She always loves to dance to the demo songs! and I love it because it has volume control unlike regular kid toy pianos. Its also very durable. With the batteries in she likes that she can carry it around wherever she pleases.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: great first keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler, and she really likes it. I didn't do 5 stars only because I feel like it's a little expensive once you add in the power supply.
customer_reviews.author: David Royal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, nice gift for my eight year old and I have had some fun with it too! I wish it came with it’s own AC adapter though, it always seems cheap to me when things don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Nause

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed by a 3 yo boy.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson. He's 3. Enjoys it immensely! This little keyboard is tough too.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Cruel

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great little piano for my 6 year old. He spends so much time playing with it. This was a great purchase, we will be moving onto a real keyboard as he is really interested in playing songs now thanks to this piano.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R Serna

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice size keyboard for a young person. I was surprised at the sound. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Wood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift my 5 year old. Very awesome little piano. Perfect in size and great features.
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: Grandchild loved it. He's 4. Very small but sounds surprisingly good. I enjoyed playing with it before I wrapped it. 😏
customer_reviews.author: Pj

customer_reviews.title: My little one looooves it!! In passing, ...
customer_reviews.text: My little one looooves it!! In passing, invest in some AA rechargeable batteries for this piano, you'll thank yourself for doin' so.
customer_reviews.author: tBway

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard for figuring out harmonies and other vocal related things.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Was a great gift
customer_reviews.text: For such a little keyboard, lots of sound and fun things to tinker with. My 20 year old asked for this.
customer_reviews.author: moocher

customer_reviews.title: Good for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Bought so my kid could keep up with practice while we were on summer vacation. Keys feel good- almost comparable to the weighted keys on his digital piano.
customer_reviews.author: Soldier

customer_reviews.title: Upset with Amazon for not boxing this. No surprise as  Christmas gift now for my son
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that Amazon does not box this keyboard. It comes in its own box, which messed up being a surprise for Christmas by my son who saw it on the porch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these for gifts from ages two to seventy. Well received. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: sororitysis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my autistic son who loves music. This is one of his favorite things to play.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Very fun little piano, great value
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying the piano more than we thought we would, great value! It's the best gift for any one who enjoys making music.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Realistic sound
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a realistic sound. I like that it automatically shuts itself off after a few minutes of not playing it. Saves money on batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Beginner
customer_reviews.text: It's a very basic beginner keyboard. It doesn't have velocity sensitive keys, so it lacks that emotional ability.
customer_reviews.author: barbara hemmingson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 3-4 year old
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. Endless options for sounds and tunes. Battery power or optional adapter is perfect for a kid. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SfxWolf

customer_reviews.title: GOOD DELIVERY!
customer_reviews.text: CASIO KB WAS NOT REALLY FOR ME BUT FOR A 15 YR OLD GIRL WHO WANTS TO LEARN MUSIC...

product_meta.title: Casio SA-46 -Portable Keyboard (32 mini keys)
product_meta.description: Style:KeyboardMore than just a toy-ultimately small children will have lots of fun playing the 32 keys right from the start. The SA-46 mini keyboard comes with a new sound source and 8-note polyphony. It includes 100 timbres and 50 rhythms. This is also revealed by the LC display: the SA-46 is a serious playmate. Another highlight is the simple change-over switch: on the SA-46 for switching between the piano and organ sound. The instrument has a cool retro design which combines bright green and black.
